name: Html.Attributes.Extra

values.name: boolProperty
values.comment: Create arbitrary bool _properties_.

values.name: floatProperty
values.comment: Create arbitrary floating-point _properties_.

values.name: high
values.comment: The lower numeric bound of the high end of the measured range, used with the meter element.

values.name: intProperty
values.comment: Create arbitrary integer _properties_.

values.name: low
values.comment: The upper numeric bound of the low end of the measured range, used with the meter element.

values.name: optimum
values.comment: This attribute indicates the optimal numeric value, used with the meter element.

values.name: role
values.comment:
Used to annotate markup languages with machine-extractable semantic information about the purpose of an element.
See the [official specs](http://www.w3.org/TR/role-attribute/).

values.name: static
values.comment:
Embedding static attributes.

Works alike to [`Html.Extra.static`](Html-Extra#static).

values.name: stringProperty
values.comment: Create arbitrary string _properties_.

values.name: valueAsFloat
values.comment:
Uses `valueAsNumber` to update an input with a floating-point value.
This should only be used on <input> of type `number`, `range`, or `date`.
It differs from `value` in that a floating point value will not necessarily overwrite the contents on an input element.

    valueAsFloat 2.5 -- e.g. will not change the displayed value for input showing "2.5000"

    valueAsFloat 0.4 -- e.g. will not change the displayed value for input showing ".4"

values.name: valueAsInt
values.comment:
Uses `valueAsNumber` to update an input with an integer value.
This should only be used on <input> of type `number`, `range`, or `date`.
It differs from `value` in that an integer value will not necessarily overwrite the contents on an input element.

    valueAsInt 18 -- e.g. will not change the displayed value for input showing "00018"

values.name: volume
values.comment: Audio volume, starting from 0.0 (silent) up to 1.0 (loudest).

name: Html.Events.Extra

values.name: charCode
values.comment:
Character code for key board events.
This is being deprecated, but support for DOM3 Keyboard events is not yet present in most browsers.

values.name: onChange
values.comment:
An HTML Event attribute that passes the `event.target.value` to a `msg`
constructor when an `input`, `select`, or `textarea` element has changed.

values.name: onClickPreventDefault
values.comment: Always send `msg` upon click, preventing the browser's default behavior.

values.name: onClickPreventDefaultAndStopPropagation
values.comment: Always send `msg` upon click, preventing the browser's default behavior and propagation

values.name: onClickStopPropagation
values.comment: Always send `msg` upon click, preventing click propagation.

values.name: onEnter
values.comment:
When the enter key is released, send the `msg`.
Otherwise, do nothing.

values.name: targetSelectedIndex
values.comment:
Parse the index of the selected option of a select.
Returns Nothing in place of the spec's magic value -1.

values.name: targetValueFloat
values.comment: Floating-point target value.

values.name: targetValueFloatParse
values.comment:
Parse a floating-point value from the input instead of using `valueAsNumber`.
Use this with inputs that do not have a `number` type.

values.name: targetValueInt
values.comment: Integer target value.

values.name: targetValueIntParse
values.comment:
Parse an integer value from the input instead of using `valueAsNumber`.
Use this with inputs that do not have a `number` type.

values.name: targetValueMaybe
values.comment: String or empty target value.

values.name: targetValueMaybeFloat
values.comment: Floating-point or empty target value.

values.name: targetValueMaybeFloatParse
values.comment:
Parse an optional floating-point value from the input instead of using `valueAsNumber`.
Use this with inputs that do not have a `number` type.

values.name: targetValueMaybeInt
values.comment: Integer or empty target value.

values.name: targetValueMaybeIntParse
values.comment:
Parse an optional integer value from the input instead of using `valueAsNumber`.
Use this with inputs that do not have a `number` type.

name: Html.Extra

values.name: nothing
values.comment:
Render nothing.

A more idiomatic way of rendering nothing compared to using
`Html.text ""` directly.

values.name: static
values.comment:
Embedding static html.

The type argument
[`Never`](http://package.elm-lang.org/packages/elm-lang/core/latest/Basics#Never)
in `Html Never` tells us that the html has no event handlers attached,
it will not generate any messages. We may want to embed such static
html into arbitrary views, while using types to enforce the
staticness. That is what this function provides.

_Note:_ To call this function, the argument need not be literally of type
`Html Never`. It suffices if it is a fully polymorphic (in the message type)
`Html` value. For example, this works: `static (Html.text "abcdef")`.

values.name: viewIf
values.comment:
A function to only render html under a certain condition

    fieldView : Model -> Html Msg
    fieldView model =
        div
            []
            [ fieldInput model
            , viewIf
                (not <| List.isEmpty model.errors)
                errorsView
            ]

values.name: viewIfLazy
values.comment:
Just like `viewIf` except its more performant. In viewIf, the html is always evaluated, even if its not rendered. `viewIfLazy` only evaluates your view function if it needs to. The trade off is your view function needs to accept a unit type (`()`) as its final parameter

    fieldView : Model -> Html Msg
    fieldView model =
        div
            []
            [ fieldInput model
            , viewIf
                (not <| List.isEmpty model.errors)
                errorsView
            ]
